      • find

        public java.awt.Component find(abbot.finder.Matcher m)
        Find a component. Returns null if no match is found instead of throwing a ComponentSearchException.
        Specified by:
        find in interface abbot.finder.ComponentFinder
        Overrides:
        find in class abbot.finder.BasicFinder
        Parameters:
        m - The matcher to use to find the component.
        Returns:
        Returns the matching component if found, or null if no match is found.

      • find

        public java.awt.Component find(abbot.finder.Matcher matcher,
                               GuiRelative relationship,
                               java.awt.Component relative)
        Find a component with the built-in BasicFinder. Returns null if no match is found instead of throwing a ComponentSearchException.
        Parameters:
        relative - a reference component that has a specific relationship with the desired target component.
        matcher - The matcher to use to find the component.
        Returns:
        Returns the matching component if found, or null if no match is found.

      • find

        public java.awt.Component find(java.lang.String descriptor,
                               GuiRelative relationship,
                               java.awt.Component relative)
                        throws abbot.finder.ComponentSearchException
        Find a component using a DescriptionMatcher. Returns null if no match is found instead of throwing a ComponentSearchException.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - The text to search for. Many different textual fields of components are compared with this. Encapsulate regular expressions inside slashes (e.g. /[a-z]+/ )
        Returns:
        Returns the matching component if found, or null if no match is found.
        Throws:
        abbot.finder.ComponentSearchException
